title: Car / Road / Traveling, etc. Font
content:
I’m looking for a typeface that references road and travel signage – any thoughts beyond Din and Interstate?

 [‹ Looking for Type Specimen PDFs](http://web.archive.org/web/20070816114448/http:/typophile.com/node/19801 "Go to previous forum topic") [Afro Clinic Card ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070816114448/http:/typophile.com/node/19748 "Go to next forum topic")
author: andres

comments.content: Euro or US? The URW [Transport](http://web.archive.org/web/20070816114448/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=transport) and [Traffic](http://web.archive.org/web/20070816114448/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Traffic) series has European roadsign roots.
[FF City Street Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20070816114448/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FF%252BCity%252BStreet%252BType) is based on Berlin street signs.

I just popped over to wikipedia and their is quite a few typefaces it mentions, so maybe that could be a little bit of help: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Street\_sign](http://web.archive.org/web/20070816114448/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Street_sign "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Street\_sign") .

...and slightly related, if you count signage on vehicles:

[National Codes Pi](http://web.archive.org/web/20070816114448/http:/store.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P_1426.html)

FF Info, Myriad, Frutiger, Scene, Gotham, Proxima Nova

Mikey
